page.title: 10THE DUDDON INSHORE RESCUE
page.content: This marine service of support,care and, when necessary, succor and rescue of sea going personel, professional and sporting, is completely privately funded from the local residents and surrounding community. Founded soon after the last World War by a group of local enthusiasts it has evolved into an up-to-date rescue service with modern equipment in the form of rescue craft and ancillary support equipment. Although not under the control of the R.N.L.I., in a direct sense, the Inshore Rescue Service works with full cooperation and liason with the local National Lifeboat Service branch and is now highly respected by all who are connected with the sea. The Roll of Honour on display in the boathouse clearly illustrates the valuable service given by this organisation.
